intro: Aidia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved aidia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, small leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other shrubs and herbs.
